professional_summary.title: Professional Summary
professional_summary.text: ICT Support / Hardware Technician with 15+ years of hands-on experience across desktop support, hardware repair, networking basics, and customer-facing troubleshooting. Background includes technical support in a web hosting environment (tickets + phone/chat), board-level microsoldering, and long-term freelance ICT support for households and SMEs. Strong Windows/macOS support, network fundamentals (DNS/DHCP/IP/Wi-Fi), Microsoft 365, and remote support tooling. German A2.2 (oral, fide) in progress; fluent Spanish and advanced English.

groups.title: IT Support & Operations
items: Hardware diagnostics & repair: PCs/laptops, component swaps (RAM/SSD/battery), peripherals
Printer & peripheral troubleshooting; endpoint security concepts; user support & documentation
Basic deployment/imaging (basic) | Remote support: RDP, AnyDesk, TeamViewer, Zoho Assist

groups.title: Enterprise & Infrastructure (practical)
items: Microsoft 365 / Outlook / Exchange basics (advanced user support)
Active Directory / account management (basic); Citrix environment exposure
Networking fundamentals (strong): DNS, DHCP, IP addressing, Wi-Fi troubleshooting
Hosting stack support: cPanel/WHM, Plesk, domains/DNS, email delivery (IMAP/SMTP), WordPress

groups.title: Tools & Process
items: Ticketing & case handling: Jira, WHMCS, Ubersmith (high-volume support workflows)
Clear customer communication; structured troubleshooting; escalation when required

highlights: L1 technical support via tickets + calls/chat for hosting customers; high ownership of cases
Supported cPanel/WHM & Plesk environments, domains/DNS, email delivery (IMAP/SMTP), and WordPress troubleshooting
High first-contact resolution rate; collaborated closely with L2 and sysadmin teams
Typical throughput: ~30-50 tickets/day plus 5-20 calls/day during normal operations
Consistently strong QA/CSAT performance (reported >95% over multiple periods)
Participated in incident/disaster-recovery work (Citrix-related incident): validation tasks, customer communications, and infrastructure-level checks with expanded access (Acronis backups)
Board-level diagnosis and microsoldering under microscope; SMD component rework and repair
Devices: iPhone (majority), Android phones, tablets/iPads, laptops (Mac/Windows), and misc. electronics
Diagnostics using multimeter (voltages/continuity/shorts); schematic reading for targeted testing (as needed)
Customer intake at counter: explained options, risks, costs, and repair viability; handled follow-up
Shop output: team handled ~20-30 repairs/day; success rate reported >90% with 3-month warranty

items.role: Owner / Freelance ICT Support & Hardware Technician
highlights: On-site and remote ICT support for households and SMEs (restaurants, offices, retail, associations)
Windows/macOS/Linux installations and configuration; PC build/repair; end-user troubleshooting
Consumer networking setup and Wi-Fi troubleshooting; CCTV deployments over Ethernet with secure remote access
Managed client communication, scheduling, quoting, billing (incl. formal invoicing via Monotributo)
Achieved high resolution rates (approx. >90% software, ~70% hardware); improved turnaround over time
Retainer client: Nodo Distribuciones - quarterly remote support + website/mail services administration
Reliable performance in a high-pace environment; strong teamwork, accuracy, and consistency
Used role as a bridge job to integrate locally and improve German in daily practice
